bibl.title: State of Nebraska Department of Trade and Commerce Bureau of Insurance Summary of Insurance Business in Nebraska for the year 1928

respStmt.name: OCLC Online Computer Library Center Inc.

p.seg: State of Nebraska DEPARTMENT OF Trade and Commerce Bureau of Insurance Summary of Insurance Business in Nebraska for the year 1928 * Also Comparative Figures of Authorized Companies for the years 1925, 1926 and 1927
■i

To His Excellency: Hon. Arthur J. Weaver, Governor. We herewith submit the summary of business of companies authorized to -write insurance in this State for the year ending December 31, 1928, including the names of companies organized, admitted, reinsured, withdrawn, examined, etc., during the year, also deposit of securities of domestic companies. DEPARTMENT OF TRADE AND COMMERCE, J. L. KIZER, Acting insurance Commissioner. CLARENCE G. BUSS, Secretary.
Lincoln Hail Insurance Company, Lincoln, Nebraska. Missouri Valley Life Insurance Company, Lincoln, Nebraska. Writes Life. National Progressive Life Insurance Company, Omaha, Nebraska.

COMPANIES OF OTHER STATES ADMITTED TO NEBRASKA IN 1928 Acacia Mutual Life Association, Washington, D. C. Writes life. American Automobile Fire Insurance Company, St. Louis, Mo. Writes Fire and Marine. American Equitable Assurance Company of New York, New York, N. Y. Writes Fire and Marine. American National Assurance Company, St. Louis, Mo. Writes Life. Baltimore American Insurance Company, New York, N. Y. Writes Fire and Marine. Degree of Honor Protective Association (Superior Lodge) St. Paul, Minn. Writes Fraternal. Empire State Insurance Company, Watertown, N. Y. Writes Fire and Marine. General Indemnity Corporation of America, Rochester, N. Y, Writes Burglary, Theft and Forgery. Independence Fire Insurance Company, Philadelphia, Pa. Writes Fire, Lightning, Explosion, Tornado, Earthquake, Hailstorm, Sprinkler, Riot, Inland Marine and Automobile. La Salle Fire Insurance Company, New Orleans, La. Writes Fire, Lightning, Tornado, Windstorm, Automobile and Marine. Merchants Indemnity Corporation of New York, New York, N. Y. Writes Liability, Burglary, Theft, Forgery and Glass. Merchants and Manufacturers Fire Insurance Company, Newark, N. J. Writes Fire. Mohawk Fire Insurance Company, New York, N. Y. Writes Fire and Marine. Mutual Plate Glass Insurance Company, Shelby, Ohio. Writes Plate Glass. New York Fire Insurance Company, New York, N. Y. Writes Fire. North American Title Guaranty Company, New York, N. Y. Writes Title. Occidental Insurance Company, San Francisco, Calif. Writes Fire, Marine, Team and Vehicle, Automobile and Miscel - laneous. Peoples National Fire Insurance Company of Wilmington, Delaware, New York, N. Y. Writes Fire. Polish Roman Catholic Union of America, Chicago, HI. Writes Fraternal.

COMPANIES OF OTHER STATES ADMITTED TO NEBRASKA IN 1928— (Concluded) Provident Life and Accident Insurance Company, Chattanooga, Term. Writes Life, Health and Accident. Reserve Loan Life Insurance Company, Indianapolis, Ind. Writes Life. Rochester American Insurance Company, New York, N. Y. Writes Fire and Marine. 4 Southern Surety Company of New York, New York, N. Y. Writes Miscellaneous Insurance. Sylvania Insurance Company, Philadelphia, Pa. Writes Fire and Marine. Twentieth Century Life Company, Chicago, 111. Writes Life, Health and Accident. Universal Insurance Company of Newark, N. J., New York, N. Y. Writes Fire and Marine as specified in Section 7814, Sub-division 1, Compiled (Statutes of Nebraska, 1922. Virginia Fire and Marine Insurance Company, Richmond, Virginia. Writes Fire, Tornado, Windstorm and Cyclone and Sprinkler Leak - age. Wisconsin Automobile Insurance Company, Monroe, Wis. Writes Automobile full coverage, Accident, Plate Glass and Burg - lary. Yorkshire Indemnity Company of New York, New York, N. Y. Writes Liability, Automobile and Aircraft. Yorkshire Insurance Company, Ltd., of York, England, New York, N. Y. Writes Fire, Motor Vehicle, Earthquake, Inland Navigation and Transportation, Tornado, Windstorm, Cyclone, Sprinkler Leakage, Riot, Civil Commotion and Explosion.

NEBRASKA INSURANCE REPORT 7 COMPANIES THAT REINSURED, REINCORPORATED, CHANGED NAME, CHANGED PLAN OF DOING BUSINESS, WITH- DREW, ETC. IN 1928 Reinsured Columbia Life Insurance Company, Omaha, Nebraska, reinsured by the American Old Line Insurance Company, Omaha, Nebraska, May 31, 1928. Degree of Honor Protective Association of Nebraska, Lincoln, Nebraska, reinsured the Beneficial Department with the Superior Lodge, De - gree of Honor Protective Association, Saint Paul, Minnesota, No - vember 28, 1928. Fraternal Protective Association, Boston, Massachusetts, reinsured by Fraternal Protective Insurance Company, Boston, Massachusetts, April 4, 1928. North American National Life Insurance Company, Omaha, Nebraska, reinsured by the Inter-Southern Life Insurance Company, Louis - ville, Kentucky, March 1, 1928. Pioneer Indemnity Company, Lincoln, Nebraska, reinsured by the Pio - neer Insurance Company, Lincoln, Nebraska. Reincorporated Southern Surety Company, Des Moines, Iowa, reincorporated as the Southern Surety Company of New York, August 8, 1928. Western Travelers Accident Association of Nebraska, Omaha, Nebraska, reincorporated as a California company, Los Angeles, California, May 1, 1928. Changed Name Employers Indemnity Corporation, Kansas City, Missouri, changed name to Employers Reinsurance Corporation, September 17, 1928. Changed Plan Pioneer Insurance Company, Lincoln, Nebraska, amended its article* to include Life business and now writes Life, Accident and Health. Protective Fire Insurance Company, Seward, Nebraska, changed from an assessment fire to a mutual fire company, December 31, 1928. National Travelers Casualty Company, Des Moines, Iowa, changed from an assessment casualty to a mutual casualty company, January 28, 1928. Withdrew Equity Fire Insurance Company, Kansas City, Missouri, withdrew May 1, 1928. Fraternal Order of Eagles, Kansas City, Missouri, withdrew December 31, 1928. .

COMPANIES THAT REINSURED, REINCORPORATED, CHANGED NAME, CHANGED PLAN OF DOING BUSINESS, WITH- DREW, ETC. IN 1928 (Concluded) Henry Clay Fire Insurance Company, Lexington, Kentucky, withdrew December 31, 1928. National Benevolent Society, Kansas City, Missouri, withdrew July 4, 1928. Royal Union Life Insurance Company, Des Moines, Iowa, withdrew December 31, 1928. Tokio Marine and Fire Insurance Company, Tokio, Japan, withdrew January 1, 1928. Union Labor Life Insurance Company, Washington, D. C, withdrew May 1, 1928. World Auxiliary Insurance Corporation, Ltd., London, England, with - drew from the United States December 31, 1928.

NEBRASKA INSURANCE REPORT 9 COMPANIES OF OTHER STATES ADMITTED TO NEBRASKA FROM JANUARY 1, 1929 TO JULY 1, 1929 Alliance Casualty Co., Philadelphia, Pa. Writes all classes of Casualty insurance except Credit. American Bonding Ins. Co., Baltimore, Md. Writes Fidelity, Surety, Burglary and Plate Glass, American and Foreign Ins. Co. of New York, New York, N. Y, Writes Fire and Marine. American Indemnity Co., Galveston, Texas, Writes Automobile. Bankers Indemnity Ins. Co., Newark, N. J. Writes Accident, Health, Automobile, Liability, Workmen's Compen - sation, Plate Glass, Burglary and Theft. British General Ins. Co., Ltd., London, England, New York, N. Y. Writes Fire. Bronx Fire Ins. Co., New York, N. Y. Writes Fire. Brooklyn Fire Ins. Co., Brooklyn, N. Y Writes Fire. Commonwealth Casualty Co., Philadelphia, Pa. Writes Accident and Health, Automobile and Plate Glass. Dixie Fire Ins. Co., Greensboro, North Carolina. Writes Fire and Allied Lines. Epperson Underwriters, Kansas City, Mo. Writes Fire Insurance on the Reciprocal and Inter-Insurance Plan. Fidelity and Guaranty Fire Corporation, Baltimore, Md. Writes Fire and Inland Marine. Halifax Fire Ins. Co. of Halifax, Nova Scotia, New York, N. Y. Writes Fire. Homestead Fire Ins. Co., Baltimore, Md. Writes Fire. Lumbermen's Reciprocal Association, Houston, Texas. Writes Workmen's Compensation, Employers Liability, Public Lia - bility and Automobile. Minnesota Fire Ins. Co., Chatfield, Minn. Writes Fire, Tornado, Windstorm and Cyclone. Northern Fire Ins. Co., New York, N. Y. Writes Fire and Marine. Northwest Casualty Co., Seattle, Washington. Writes Automobile, Plate Glass and Burglary. Plate Glass Reciprocal Underwriters, Kansas City, Mo. Writes Plate Glass, Burglary, and all other classes of Casualty In - surance except Employers Liability and Workmen's Compensation. Seaboard Fire and Marine Ins. Co., New York, N. Y. Writes Fire and Marine.

10 COMPANIES OF OTHER STATES ADMITTED TO NEBRASKA FROM JANUARY 1, 1929 TO JULY 1, 1929 (Concluded) Southern Fire Ins. Co. of New York, St. Louis, Mo, Writes Fire. Transportation Indemnity Co., New York, N. Y. Writes Health, Accident, Liability, Fidelity, Surety, Burglary, Theft, Forgery, Glass, Steam Boiler, Live Stock, Automobile, Aircraft, Sprinkler and Elevator. Universal Casualty Underwriters, Kansas City, Mo. Writes Employers Liability, Public Liability, Workmen's Compen- sation, Plate Glass and Automobile Insurance on the Reciprocal and Inter-Insurance Plan. COMPANIES ORGANIZED IN NEBRASKA FROM JANUARY 1, 1929 TO JULY 1, 1929 American States Life Ins. Co., Lincoln, Nebraska, Writes Life. Central States Hail Ins. Co., Omaha, Nebraska Writes Hail. CHANGES IN COMPANIES FROM JANUARY 1, 1929 TO JULY 1, 1929 National Life Association, Des Moines, Iowa. Changed name to National Life Company. Plan was changed from assessment life to mutual legal reserve, January 30, 1929. World Accident Association, Omaha, Nebraska. Changed name to World Insurance Company, January 8, 1929. Lloyd's Plate Glass Insurance Company, New York. Changed name to Lloyd's Casualty Company, February 8, 1929. Reinsurance Life Company of America, Des Moines, Iowa. Changed to an Illinois corporation June 21, 1929, with headquarters at 720 North Michigan Blvd., Chicago, Illinois. All business of the Iowa Company reinsured by the Illinois company. Pacific Fire Insurance Company, New York. Withdrew April 30, 1929.
